doc:
is the common base class for widgets which visualize an adjustment, e.g or .

Apart from signals for monitoring the parameters of the adjustment, provides properties and methods for influencing the sensitivity of the “steppers”. It also provides properties and methods for setting a “fill level” on range widgets. See .

methods.doc: Get the which is the “model” object for . See for details. The return value does not have a reference added, so should not be unreferenced.
methods.name: get_adjustment

methods.doc: Gets the current position of the fill level indicator.
methods.name: get_fill_level

methods.doc: Gets the value set by .
methods.name: get_flippable

methods.doc: Gets the value set by .
methods.name: get_inverted

methods.doc: Gets the sensitivity policy for the stepper that points to the 'lower' end of the GtkRange’s adjustment.
methods.name: get_lower_stepper_sensitivity

methods.doc:
This function is useful mainly for subclasses.

See .
methods.name: get_min_slider_size

methods.doc:
This function returns the area that contains the range’s trough and its steppers, in widget->window coordinates.

This function is useful mainly for subclasses.
methods.name: get_range_rect

methods.doc: Gets whether the range is restricted to the fill level.
methods.name: get_restrict_to_fill_level

methods.doc: Gets the number of digits to round the value to when it changes. See .
methods.name: get_round_digits

methods.doc: Gets whether the range displays the fill level graphically.
methods.name: get_show_fill_level

methods.doc:
This function returns sliders range along the long dimension, in widget->window coordinates.

This function is useful mainly for subclasses.
methods.name: get_slider_range

methods.doc:
This function is useful mainly for subclasses.

See .
methods.name: get_slider_size_fixed

methods.doc: Gets the sensitivity policy for the stepper that points to the 'upper' end of the GtkRange’s adjustment.
methods.name: get_upper_stepper_sensitivity

methods.doc: Gets the current value of the range.
methods.name: get_value

methods.doc: Sets the adjustment to be used as the “model” object for this range widget. The adjustment indicates the current range value, the minimum and maximum range values, the step/page increments used for keybindings and scrolling, and the page size. The page size is normally 0 for and nonzero for , and indicates the size of the visible area of the widget being scrolled. The page size affects the size of the scrollbar slider.
methods.name: set_adjustment

methods.doc:
Set the new position of the fill level indicator.

The “fill level” is probably best described by its most prominent use case, which is an indicator for the amount of pre-buffering in a streaming media player. In that use case, the value of the range would indicate the current play position, and the fill level would be the position up to which the file/stream has been downloaded.

This amount of prebuffering can be displayed on the range’s trough and is themeable separately from the trough. To enable fill level display, use . The range defaults to not showing the fill level.

Additionally, it’s possible to restrict the range’s slider position to values which are smaller than the fill level. This is controller by and is by default enabled.
methods.name: set_fill_level

methods.doc:
If a range is flippable, it will switch its direction if it is horizontal and its direction is .rtl.

See .
methods.name: set_flippable

methods.doc: Sets the step and page sizes for the range. The step size is used when the user clicks the arrows or moves via arrow keys. The page size is used for example when moving via Page Up or Page Down keys.
methods.name: set_increments

methods.doc: Ranges normally move from lower to higher values as the slider moves from top to bottom or left to right. Inverted ranges have higher values at the top or on the right rather than on the bottom or left.
methods.name: set_inverted

methods.doc: Sets the sensitivity policy for the stepper that points to the 'lower' end of the GtkRange’s adjustment.
methods.name: set_lower_stepper_sensitivity

methods.doc:
Sets the minimum size of the range’s slider.

This function is useful mainly for subclasses.
methods.name: set_min_slider_size

methods.doc: Sets the allowable values in the , and clamps the range value to be between min and max. (If the range has a non-zero page size, it is clamped between min and max - page-size.)
methods.name: set_range

methods.doc: Sets whether the slider is restricted to the fill level. See for a general description of the fill level concept.
methods.name: set_restrict_to_fill_level

methods.doc: Sets the number of digits to round the value to when it changes. See .
methods.name: set_round_digits

methods.doc: Sets whether a graphical fill level is show on the trough. See for a general description of the fill level concept.
methods.name: set_show_fill_level

methods.doc:
Sets whether the range’s slider has a fixed size, or a size that depends on its adjustment’s page size.

This function is useful mainly for subclasses.
methods.name: set_slider_size_fixed

methods.doc: Sets the sensitivity policy for the stepper that points to the 'upper' end of the GtkRange’s adjustment.
methods.name: set_upper_stepper_sensitivity

methods.doc: Sets the current value of the range; if the value is outside the minimum or maximum range values, it will be clamped to fit inside them. The range emits the signal if the value changes.
methods.name: set_value

name: Range

properties.doc: The fill level (e.g. prebuffering of a network stream). See .
properties.name: fill-level

properties.doc: The restrict-to-fill-level property controls whether slider movement is restricted to an upper boundary set by the fill level. See .
properties.name: restrict-to-fill-level

properties.doc: The number of digits to round the value to when it changes, or -1. See .
properties.name: round-digits

properties.doc: The show-fill-level property controls whether fill level indicator graphics are displayed on the trough. See .
properties.name: show-fill-level

signals.doc: Emitted before clamping a value, to give the application a chance to adjust the bounds.
signals.name: adjust-bounds

signals.doc:
The signal is emitted when a scroll action is performed on a range. It allows an application to determine the type of scroll event that occurred and the resultant new value. The application can handle the event itself and return true to prevent further processing. Or, by returning false, it can pass the event to other handlers until the default GTK+ handler is reached.

The value parameter is unrounded. An application that overrides the GtkRange::change-value signal is responsible for clamping the value to the desired number of decimal digits; the default GTK+ handler clamps the value based on .

It is not possible to use delayed update policies in an overridden handler.
signals.name: change-value

signals.doc: Virtual function that moves the slider. Used for keybindings.
signals.name: move-slider
